  "title": "Graphic Design Assistant",
  "description": "The United Nations is the one international organization with the reach and vision capable of solving global problems. The United Nations Foundation links the UN&#39;s work with others around the world, mobilizing the energy and expertise of business and non-governmental organizations to help the UN tackle issues including climate change, global health, peace and security, women&#39;s empowerment, poverty eradication, energy access, and U.S.-UN relations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Design Assistant

Job Opening ID: 264105
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Category and Level: Consultants, CON
Department/Office:&nbsp;Resident Coordinator System

Result of Service


	The Graphic Design Assistant is expected to deliver graphics designs for the UN80, and provide professional support for booths/Tents to be used by UN inter-agencies for the exhibitions, Graphics designs for banners and other promotional materials for 16-days activism from November 25 (International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women) to December 10 (Human Rights Day), and; Supervision of the artwork of the production of the UN Nigeria table top 2026 calendars.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Background The Graphic Design Assistant is required to professionally carry out visual communication projects and initiatives across several media by developing high quality materials for campaigns, workshops, dialogues, meetings with the idea to raise awareness and inspire action on Agenda 2030 and the SDGs in Nigeria and inspire change through pictures.
	This is part of the implementation of the global UN communication strategy at national level, working closely with the Resident Coordinator and UN Country Team in Nigeria through the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework.


Reporting Line:


	The Graphic Design Assistant will report to the Head of the Resident Coordinator&#39;s Office and UNIC will play a day-today supervision role. Location/Duty Station Abuja Responsibilities:
	Design themes, infographics, Layouts and covers of documents.
	Development of figures, including colours, fonts, graphics and layout, and resulting materials such as Newsletters, brochures, banners, posters, fliers and booklets.
	Creation of graphic templates to be used for reports and presentations.
	Preparation of printing packages (all layout and design files) for printing of publications and other communication products (brochures, annual reports, banners, posters, booklets, leaflets, books, calendars, bulletins, flyers, cards)
	Deliver creative and innovative ideas for print, web and interactive presentations. This will require the graphic designer to provide technical solutions for use of new media
	Create animations for illustrative purposes such as animations, presentations and more advanced solutions
	Maintain templates (InDesign, CorelDraw, Publisher Word, PowerPoint etc)
	Provide videography and photographic support to the RCO
	Assist in establishing and be responsible for maintaining photo and video library
	Any other duties as may be requested.


Qualifications / Special skills


	A high school diploma is required.
	The years of experience are reduced by 2 for candidates who possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in a discipline relevant to IT, fine arts, Graphic Design, certified degree in CAD (computer-aided design and drafting) software relevant to the production of maps and illustrations.
	Two (2) years of experience is required in working at different CAD environment, mainly at Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Illustrator andor Corel Draw and good knowledge at Microsoft Office Word and Excel. Approved experience should be provided in case of non-academic background.


Languages


	English and French are the working languages of the United Nations Secretariat. For the post advertised, fluency in oral and written English is required.
	Knowledge of another official United Nations language is an advantage.

Graphic Design Assistant Job at the United Nations




        
    

        
        The United Nations is the one international organization with the reach and vision capable of solving global problems. The United Nations Foundation links the UN's work with others around the world, mobilizing the energy and expertise of business and non-governmental organizations to help the UN tackle issues including climate change, global health, peace and security, women's empowerment, poverty eradication, energy access, and U.S.-UN relations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphic Design Assistant

Job Opening ID: 264105
Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Category and Level: Consultants, CON
Department/Office: Resident Coordinator System
     

            
    



Result of Service


	The Graphic Design Assistant is expected to deliver graphics designs for the UN80, and provide professional support for booths/Tents to be used by UN inter-agencies for the exhibitions, Graphics designs for banners and other promotional materials for 16-days activism from November 25 (International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women) to December 10 (Human Rights Day), and; Supervision of the artwork of the production of the UN Nigeria table top 2026 calendars.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Background The Graphic Design Assistant is required to professionally carry out visual communication projects and initiatives across several media by developing high quality materials for campaigns, workshops, dialogues, meetings with the idea to raise awareness and inspire action on Agenda 2030 and the SDGs in Nigeria and inspire change through pictures.
	This is part of the implementation of the global UN communication strategy at national level, working closely with the Resident Coordinator and UN Country Team in Nigeria through the UN Sustainable Development Cooperation Framework.


Reporting Line:


	The Graphic Design Assistant will report to the Head of the Resident Coordinator's Office and UNIC will play a day-today supervision role. Location/Duty Station Abuja Responsibilities:
	Design themes, infographics, Layouts and covers of documents.
	Development of figures, including colours, fonts, graphics and layout, and resulting materials such as Newsletters, brochures, banners, posters, fliers and booklets.
	Creation of graphic templates to be used for reports and presentations.
	Preparation of printing packages (all layout and design files) for printing of publications and other communication products (brochures, annual reports, banners, posters, booklets, leaflets, books, calendars, bulletins, flyers, cards)
	Deliver creative and innovative ideas for print, web and interactive presentations. This will require the graphic designer to provide technical solutions for use of new media
	Create animations for illustrative purposes such as animations, presentations and more advanced solutions
	Maintain templates (InDesign, CorelDraw, Publisher Word, PowerPoint etc)
	Provide videography and photographic support to the RCO
	Assist in establishing and be responsible for maintaining photo and video library
	Any other duties as may be requested.


Qualifications / Special skills


	A high school diploma is required.
	The years of experience are reduced by 2 for candidates who possess a Bachelor’s degree in a discipline relevant to IT, fine arts, Graphic Design, certified degree in CAD (computer-aided design and drafting) software relevant to the production of maps and illustrations.
	Two (2) years of experience is required in working at different CAD environment, mainly at Adobe Photoshop, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Illustrator andor Corel Draw and good knowledge at Microsoft Office Word and Excel. Approved experience should be provided in case of non-academic background.


Languages


	English and French are the working languages of the United Nations Secretariat. For the post advertised, fluency in oral and written English is required.
	Knowledge of another official United Nations language is an advantage.

	Provide any other assistant required in a willing, pleasant and professional manner
	Deal with difficult situations in an assertive and friendly manner
	Ensure the reception area is clean, organized and welcoming at all times
	Receive, log, and sign incoming mails and distribute within the hour
	Source and provide relevant information to callers as appropriate
	Monitor visitor access and ensure compliance with company security protocol.


Educational Qualification


	HND or BSc in any discipline, preferably in Social Sciences
	Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Receptionist / Customer Service.


Competencies:
Knowlegde:


	Excellent telephone etiquette.


Skills:


	Good communication skill
	Excellent interpersonal skill
	Organization skill
	Switch board
	Customer service

	Consistent

Digital Content Creator / Editor Job at Cool FM / Wazobia FM




        
    

        
        Cool FM / Wazobia FM is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Digital Content Creator / Editor

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Media & Entertainment

Description


	Are you a creative storyteller with a passion for pop culture, digital trends, and high-impact content?
	Join our team where media meets innovation as a Digital Content Creator/Editor and help shape the stories that move our audience.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Develop and execute content strategies aligned with our brand voice, audience interests, and business goals.
	Generate creative, on-trend ideas for shows, social media, web, and promotional campaigns.
	Create high-quality multimedia content — including copywriting, graphics, videos, and interactive posts — optimized for each platform.
	Edit and proofread content to maintain quality, consistency, and brand tone.
	Collaborate closely with presenters, producers, designers, and marketing to deliver cohesive campaigns.
	Manage and update content calendars for shows, social, and digital platforms.
	Monitor performance analytics (engagement, reach, listenership) and adjust strategies accordingly.
	Stay updated on pop culture, entertainment, and digital media trends to keep content fresh and relevant.
	Support live coverage of events, interviews, and campaigns across platforms.


Ideal Candidate


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	1–3 years of relevant experience in digital content, media production, or social media
	Excellent writing, editing, and visual storytelling skills
	Familiarity with content creation tools (e.g., Adobe Suite, Canva, CapCut, etc.)
	Proactive, trend-savvy, and highly collaborative
	Able to work in a fast-paced, media-driven environment


Bonus Skills:


	Photography and videography
	Understanding of SEO, analytics, and social media advertising
	Experience managing livestreams or live event content.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, cover letter, and any relevant portfolio/sample work to: ehelen@coolwazobiainfo.com using “Digital Content Creator Application” as the subject of the mail.
